multiple.question: Which is the independent variable in the Effect of Temperature on Enzyme Activity experiment?

answers.answer: Hydrogen peroxide
Liver
Temperature
Amount of water and hydrogen gas

figure.header: Effect of Temperature on Enzyme Activity
figure.text: A student wants to see how temperature affects enzyme activity. She plans to use liver and hydrogen peroxide for the experiment. Liver contains an enzyme that breaks down hydrogen peroxide into water and hydrogen gas.

multiple.question: Which is the dependent variable in the Effect of Temperature on Enzyme Activity experiment?

answers.answer: Hydrogen peroxide
Liver
Temperature
Amount of water and hydrogen gas

figure.header: Effect of Temperature on Enzyme Activity
figure.text: A student wants to see how temperature affects enzyme activity. She plans to use liver and hydrogen peroxide for the experiment. Liver contains an enzyme that breaks down hydrogen peroxide into water and hydrogen gas.

scene.matchingInstructions: Match the items on the left to the correct areas on the right.
scene.instructions: When you are done, check your results by clicking 'Check Answers.'

hotspots.hotspot:
Range

The experimental group should have a range of treatments.

Intervals

The treatments should occur at regular intervals.

Number

The experimental group should have a set number of treatments, including the maximum treatment level.

Why?

Replicates increase the chances of drawing a valid conclusion.

How many?

Replicates are needed for every treatment of the experiment.

multiple.question: How many treatments are in this experiment?
How many replicates are used in each treatment?
What is the minimum number of bean plants that will be necessary to conduct this experiment?

multiple.question: Which option is the best design choice for an experiment on the effect of temperature on the evaporation of water from plants?

answers.answer: The student has three treatment groups. Group 1 grows at 0°C, Group 2 grows at 25°C, and Group 3 grows at 100°C.
The student has three treatment groups. Group 1 grows at 20°C, Group 2 grows at 25°C, and Group 3 grows at 30°C.
The student has four groups. The groups are at 10-degree intervals from 0°C to 30°C.
The student has four groups. The groups are at 10-degree intervals from 10°C to 40°C.

multiple.question: Which is NOT a characteristic of a well-designed experiment?

answers.answer: It should have a range of treatments.
It has both an independent and a dependent variable.
It has a control group and an experimental group.
It has one replicate.

multiple.question: The experimental group in an experiment should have which of the following?

answers.answer: a range of treatments
at least twenty-five replicates
at least five hours of sunlight per day
has two variables

multiple.question: The control group in an experiment is exposed to which of the following?

answers.answer: the independent variable
the dependent variable
no special conditions
all possible conditions

multiple.question:
A student studying the effect of pH on enzyme activity measures the amount of product formed by the enzyme at different pH levels.

Which option is the best design choice for an experiment investigating the amount of product formed by the enzyme at different pH levels?

answers.answer: The student conducts the experiment five times at pH values of 3, 5, 7, 9, and 11.
The student conducts the experiment at pH values of 3, 4, 5, 6, and 7.
The student conducts the experiment at pH values of 1, 7, and 14.
The student conducts the experiment twice at pH values of 6, 7, and 8.

multiple.question:
A student wants to study the response of an insect known as a pill bug to changes in humidity.

Which option is the best design choice for an experiment on the response of pill bugs to changes in humidity?

answers.answer: The student gives one pill bug a choice between a chamber with 0% humidity and another with 50% humidity.
The student gives 10 pill bugs a choice between chambers of 0%, 25%, 50%, 75%, and 100% humidity.
The student gives one pill bug a choice between chambers with 0% humidity, 50% humidity and 100% humidity.
The student gives 5 pill bugs a choice between a 25% humidity chamber in the light, a 25% humidity chamber in the dark, a 50% humidity chamber in the light, and a 50% humidity chamber in the dark.
